texts.definition: Game states from which no actions or events in a game instance can let a player win.
markups: <style="Definition">Game states from which no actions or events in a game instance can let a player win.</style>

By gaming, people try to affect a game state through gameplay actions to reach some goal. Players have <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> when there exists goals which lets players win a game but there are not combinations of actions or events that make this possible.
TV Tropes has a wiki page for a similar concept, [http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Unwinnable Unwinnable].

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tic-Tac-Toe">Tic-Tac-Toe</link></style> is famously known for not having <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> for both players when they both play optimally. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/First%20to%2012">First to 12</link></style> has an <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game State</style> for the starting player if the second player plays optimally.

<style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> is typically seen as a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Negative%20Patterns">Negative Pattern</link></style> since it may cause players in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> to quit, and generally makes players feel they have no <style="Link"><link="player-agency">Player Agency</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="value-effort">Value of Effort</link></style>. They can be caused by <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominant%20Strategies">Dominant Strategies</link></style>, a <style="Link"><link="predictable-winner">Predictable Winner</link></style>, or through the actions of a <style="Link"><link="kingmaker">Kingmaker</link></style>. While <style="Link"><link="unwinnable-games">Unwinnable Games</link></style> always cause <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> this may not be a problem since these games are typically designed to give players other meaningful goals than winning.

The main ways of avoiding <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> — or at least avoiding players perceiving them — is to have <style="Link"><link="secret-scoring-mechanisms">Secret Scoring Mechanisms</link></style> or designing a game with a <style="Link"><link="winner-gameplay-ends">Winner determined after Gameplay Ends</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> can also help with this.

<style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> can be countered by <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> and is more likely to be detected when <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perfect%20Information">Perfect Information</link></style> is available.

<style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style>, or game states that are perceived to be unwinnable can lead to <style="Link"><link="surrendering">Surrendering</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="early-leaving-players">Early Leaving Players</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style>. This may be bad if a game isn't design to support this (e.g. through <style="Link"><link="possibility-graceful-surrender">Possibility of Graceful Surrender</link></style>) since players leaving are likely to disrupt <style="Link"><link="team-balance">Team Balance</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style>. However, it is not necessarily a cause of <style="Link"><link="ragequitting">Ragequitting</link></style> (but the actions of another player which puts a player in an <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game State</style> is).

<style="Link"><link="save-files">Save Files</link></style> that contain <style="CurrentLink">Unwinnable Game States</style> are likely to be seen as pointless at best in games which one tries to win, and <style="Link"><link="save-points">Save Points</link></style> can create these if not explicitly design to avoid them.
